column4: Early use of dapper: is it normal for lots of apps to close without warning?
ermm, no.
I thought (and hoped) not - google earth, totem, VLC all doing it
what do you mean exactly closing automatically?
Google earth and VLC just close as if I've clicked quit, Totem tells me it's crashed; lets me click ok
does synaptic report any broken packages?
not that i know of; can i get it to check?
it will tell you at the bottom status screen.
in gnome? no nothing like that
i see now - synaptic bottom status bar = 18843 packages listed, 1441 installed, 0 broken, 0 to install/upgrade, 0 to remove
the best suggestion I can give you is to launch the applications from the console and see what messages they give.
cool, i'll try - thanx
also worth a look is /var/log/messages :)
running VLC from terminal results in lots of errors when I try to open a DVD - can i copy them to you somehow?
use pastebin
#pastebin ? - how do i use pastebin?
terminal output in pastebin under pdanger
paste the link in here please.
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/18007
what kind of video card do you have?
from xorg.conf = Silicon Integrated Systems (SiS) 300/305 PCI/AGP VGA Display Adapter - it an 8mb vga card
I think your problem is that the video card doesn't have enough ram to do any graphics heavy stuff (like vlc, dvd playing and google earth).
really? right, Ive got a 2nd vga card in the box that dapper detected but didnt install so il play with that - thanx again
